alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 9:17PM PST until January 19 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. For the Columbia Basin, total snow and sleet accumulations 1 to 2 inches and ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch. For the Palouse and areas south, total snow and sleet accumulations near 1 inch and ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of North and North Central Idaho and East Central and Southeast Washington. * WHEN...Until 3 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will transition to a mix of sleet and freezing rain late Thursday night.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel

area.areaDesc: Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties; Northeast Blue Mountains; Upper Columbia Basin; Washington Palouse
